message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you! I think it's a great opportunity for us to work together. I'm willing to offer you the product at a price of $9500. This is a competitive price considering the product's value to you, and I believe it's a fair starting point for our negotiation.

I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8200. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm willing to make a serious commitment to work with you if we can come to an agreement on this price.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $8200. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $9000. This is a fair compromise considering the product's value to me, and I believe it's a good opportunity for us to work together.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with the price of $9000. I'm willing to pay $8500 for the product, and I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me. I'm hoping we can work out a deal at this price.

Thank you for your latest offer, Bob. I understand your desire to get the price down, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $8500. I'm willing to compromise further and offer the product to you for $8800. This is a good price considering the product's value to me, and I believe it's a fair opportunity for us to work together.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above $8800. I'm willing to pay $8400 for the product. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm hoping we can finalize a deal at this price.

Thank you for your latest offer, Bob. I understand your desire to get the price down, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $8400. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer the product to you for $8600. This is a good price considering the product's value to me, and I believe it's a fair opportunity for us to work together.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with $8600. I'm willing to pay $8200, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to explore other options.

Bob, I understand your final offer, but I'm still not willing to sell the product at $8200. I've already compromised a lot, and I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $8600 and $8200, so I'm offering the product to you for $8300. This is my final counteroffer.
